data.title: Rejecting the promise returned from provideReferences doesn't display an error to the user
data.body:
If I return a rejected promise from `provideReferences`, no error is displayed to the user and an empty "No results" window is shown.

Is this intentional?  

There seems to be different behaviour of rejected promises across the various providers.  Perhaps the docs could indicate what resolved and rejected promises are expected to mean?

data.title: Cannot delete .asar file while VS Code is open
data.body:
Hi!

It looks like VS Code opens `.asar` files to make them browsable in the workspace tree view. That sounds helpful, except it seems like a file handle is kept open at all times, preventing some packaging script of mine from deleting `.asar` files if I keep VS Code open when running it.

Would it be possible to ensure `.asar` files are only opened by VS Code if they are being browsed explicitely in the tree view? or maybe avoid keeping the file handle open on them while idling?

I'm running VS Code 0.10.2 on Windows 7 64-bit.
Thanks for a great editor! â™¥

Could be this machine related as i dont have any problems on another one. Tried to open editor after windows startup without any extra programs opened, still slow. Win 10 64bit

data.title: Support command-Y as "redo" on Mac
data.body:
MS Word, Sublime text, and others all support command-Y as the "redo" command on the Mac.
Please support this in VS Code as well.

data.title: Support Markdown Code Block Language Autocomplete

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
The markdown editor very nicely supports nested language syntax highlighting which is awesome. One small addition to make things easier is adding a autocomplete list of standard language names used in markdown. Cursor after three ticks ``` would list the languages.

Optionally showing a symbol next to languages with syntax highlighting support would be kind of cool, but not needed.

To see a list of the languages that could be included:
https://github.com/github/linguist/blob/master/lib/linguist/languages.yml

data.title: Create a pre-commit hook that checks for repo hygiene
data.body:
- [x] Make `gulp hygiene` run only through some files
- [x] Create a script which runs `git diff --cached --name-only --diff-filter=AMCRTUXB` to get the list of files to check and call `gulp hygiene` on that list

data.title: Wrong colors in d.ts after `::`
Maintain File Permissions when Copying Directories/Files on Linux and MacOS
data.body:
When copying a directory or file in the file tree on Linux and MacOS, all of the file permissions in the destination file/directory get reset to 644.

VS Code should maintain file permissions.

data.title: [TypeScript] Bug fixes #297 snippet on method suggest

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
## What is it?

This is bug fix for #297 related to completion and  also expand completion options.
## How?

"typescript.useCodeSnippetsOnMethodSuggest" option in settings now have 3 options to pick 
- [ default = lambda, func,  none   ] *

For signature like

``` typescript
interface IDoSomething {
    getData(url: string,data:{}, callback: (error, result) => void)
}
```
### lambda:

lambda option generate code like below and for ease of use just will keep first 3 letters of each parameters

``` typescript
var x: IDoSomething;
x.getData(url, data, (err, res) => {

    })
```

_Tab cycle = url, data, { } **lambda body**_
### func:

func option presume user wants to pass function as argument and generate this code

``` typescript
var x: IDoSomething;
x.getData(url, data, callback) 
```

_Tab cycle = url, data, callback_
### none:

just none ;)

data.body:
When editing come javascript files, when I add a new property to an object, upon hitting CR/Enter, the line I just typed disappears, and VSCode renders "(...token: string[]): void".  (screenshot attached.).   I cannot type further until hitting the escape key.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9296597/11401959/f02291cc-935a-11e5-96de-adbbcb795e6d.png)

In some cases, the aforementioned text does not necesarily completely overlay my prior line.

data.title: Executing a built in command does not wait for it to be executed (fixes #617)
data.body:
@alexandrudima this is for #617, can you please check if it makes sense? The intent is that commands executed via keybinding service properly connect the promises chain.

After this change I can execute a command from an extension and it will only complete when the action has completed on the renderer side.

data.title: Error list should focus file if already open
data.body: When picking an error from the error list that belongs to a file that is already open in an editor, Code should focus that editor and reveal the range instead of always using the currently focused editor and opening the file with the error in it.

data.title: Can't cancel debug environment picker
data.body: In a new project, switch to the debug viewlet and click the gear. You'll get the debug environment picker. Pressing `Escape` or clicking outside the quick open widget will not cancel the operation as expected but it will create an almost empty `launch.json` instead.

data.title: Cannot debug extensions if offline
data.body:
If my wifi is offline or my laptop is in flight mode I am unable to launch the VSCode debugger for debugging extensions.
## Steps to repo
1. Clone a repository with an extension (or `yo code`)
2. Restore npm packages
3. Open extension in VS Code
4. Press `F5`

When doing so the following error is displayed:

![vscode-error](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/434140/11396522/27d92b88-93c6-11e5-85a1-49f039dac7f6.PNG)

I've reproduced it on my machine while network disconnected and while in flight mode. Once wifi connectivity is reestablished it works just fine, I didn't close/open VS Code in between.
## System info
- Windows 10 (latest updates via fast ring)
- VS Code 0.10.1
- Node.js 4.0.0
- npm 3.4.1

data.title: TextDocument needs a dispose() method or leaks otherwise
data.body:
There currently seems to be no way of explicitly disposing a `TextDocument` instance. Only if you show it inside a `TextEditor` you are able to call a built in command to dispose the document (e.g. by closing the editor if the file is not in working files or by calling Close All Files command).

Without a dispose() method, the `workspace.textDocuments` array will leak entries.
